title: Petition: Do not remove LGBT content from the Relationships Education curriculum

last_post.content:
I am going to keep posting about this until we get to 100,000 signatures.

Yes, it's another one of these damned post from that obsessed woman, I am sorry.

As I write there are 89,316 signatures. The linear trend line of signatures from Tuesday 31 January gives an equation of
y = 861.45x + 82873.
That means the date for hitting 100,000 votes has drifted out by another day to Saturday 18 February. I know we can do better than this. The last we thing we want is the petition to remove LGBT content from the curriculum to be debated and our opinion not to be heard.

Please sign if you are in the UK and please boost if you are not.

May I take this opportunity to thank each and everyone of the 1,260 people that have boosted this post so far. 💖 💖

Petition: Do not remove LGBT content from the Relationships Education curriculum

title: SHARP | The Society for the History of Authorship, Reading and Publishing

last_post.content:
Now that we have over 500 followers, let's reintroduce ourselves!💫

📚 We are the official handle for SHARP, a global, scholarly Society for the History of #Authorship, #Reading, and #Publishing. 📚

🌍 Our aim is to create a global network for those working in #BookHistory across a broad range of scholarly disciplines. Research addresses the #Composition, #Mediation, #Reception, #Survival, and #Transformation of written #Communication in #Material forms from marks on stone to #NewMedia.

With more than a thousand members in over forty countries, SHARP works in concert with affiliated academic organizations around the world to support the study of book history in all its forms.

🕸️ Follow and tag us to get connected with our Mastodon network. And check out our website, https://www.sharpweb.org/main/ for information on how to join the SHARP-L listserv or become a member if you'd like to get more involved. 🤓

title: Schneier on Security:   Tagged movie-plot threat contests

last_post.content:
Schneier led the charge for a kind of sensible, reasonable thinking about security, using a mix of tactics to shift the discourse on the subject: debating TSA boss Kip Hawley, traveling with reporters through airport checkpoints while narrating countermeasures to defeat every single post-9/11 measure, and holding annual "movie-plot threat" competitions:

https://www.schneier.com/tag/movie-plot-threat-contests/

5/

Many readers outside of cryptography circles became familiar with Schneier through his contribution to Neal Stephenson's *Cryptonomicon*, and he is well-known in science fiction circles (he even received a Hugo nomination for editing the restaurant guide for the 2000 World Science Fiction Convention in San Jose).

https://www.schneier.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/restaurants-san-jose.pdf

3/

*A Hacker's Mind* is security expert #BruceSchneier's latest book, released today. For long-time readers of Schneier, the subject matter will be familiar, but this iteration of Schneier's core security literacy curriculum has an important new gloss: *power*.

https://wwnorton.com/books/9780393866667

title: Creatures That Don’t Conform – Lucy Jones

last_post.content:
' “Mum! Mum! I think I’ve found a slime mold!”

“No. NO??!!!” I shouted, sticking my feet halfway into my trainers and rushing out to my six-year-old daughter in our garden....

She pointed out a mass of tiny maroon tubes, clumped together on old damp pallets. The wood was loose, so I picked it up and fetched my hand lens. It was a mother-fucking slime mold. In my garden. In my garden! Holy shit. The hunt was really on. '

title: Myspace loses all content uploaded before 2016

Reminder that whatever you store on an internet site will one day vanish, even if it's stored on the largest and richest site in the world:

"Myspace, the once mighty social network, has lost every single piece of content uploaded to its site before 2016, including millions of songs, photos and videos with no other home on the internet."

https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2019/mar/18/myspace-loses-all-content-uploaded-before-2016

Please don't rely on internet services to exist forever, they will all disappear eventually.

Try to store copies of important stuff offline if you can. Music, video, photos etc can all be stored locally.

Once, a knight named Volprecht from Siegburg, who had made a deal with the Devil, blasphemed against the local Saint Anno.
